title: New CPU.
body:
I got a new AMD CPU. -'AMD FX Processor black edition'.
New Mother board, -ASRock 970 Extream4'

I already have other important parts.
1 8 Gig DDR.
2 Gig Sphire Graphics card.
1 500 Gig HD (Main Draive)
2 750 Gig HD

Then when I threw away other broken mother board and tried to put in this new one...
Case was too small :(

So, now Im buying another case + More RAM.
Lets go!
http://www.pccasegear.com/index.php?main_page=wish_lists&wlcId=423870&action=wish_lists

Whats specs does everyone have for there PC?.
Tell me I wanna know!

replies.body:
CPU- i7 4790k
CPU Cooler- Cryorig R1 Ultimate CPU Cooler 
Motherboard- ASUS Z97-A
GPU- ASUS GeForce GTX 970 Strix DirectCU II 4GB
Memory- 2x4Gb Kingston Hyper X (1866mhz)
Storage- Western Digital WD Blue 1TB WD10EZEX 
               Intel 530 240Gb SSD
PSU- EVGA SuperNOVA 750W
Case- Corsair Obsidian 450D Mid Tower Case

AsusP9x79 pro mb
I7 3930k cpu
asus ref gtx 680 2gb gpu 
2400 mhz corsair dominator 16th ddr ram
Cooler master haf  x full tower case
Cosair Force gt SSd 512gb 
cpu heat sink cooler master hyper 212 or something like it.

Had since late 2011 . Never needed to over clock (yet)
want to upgrade monitor to 4k at 120+he.  Been told gpu will work at 4k,but only at 60hz. So will wait till new gpu comes out to support at higher hz. Oh and wait for the monitor to do that as well. anyone know of one?
Check PC Case gear, Australian company. Its where i get my monitors and PC stuff from.
32gb ram, highest settings, 300 fps because f*ck lowest settings.
I would sell my mother for that

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=sx1lyVwH,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-04-23T09:51:07.068+0000)
>
> 32gb ram, highest settings, 300 fps because f*ck lowest settings.

lol do you do video editing as well because 32gb of ram is super overkill for gaming .-. but then again there is no kill like overkill.
No video editing, just sims. F*ck that sh!t uses a lot of ram...

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=sx1lyVwH,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-23T10:00:53.823+0000)
>
> No video editing, just sims. F*ck that sh!t uses a lot of ram...

Yeah for fringe cases like that I guess you would want more ram as a safety net a lot of EA games seem to use a bit too much I mean they could fix it but it's EA.

I am building a PC at the moment let me tell you one of the best resources to help you know what fits and how much it costs is pcpartpicker. You just go and select a part like a mobo etc and then it will from then on only show parts compatible with it so you don't screw up also it shows prices and places to buy from.

I was told by multiple sources that it would fit. :(
So im looking into what would actually fit it.

I use PC case gear, what do you use?

> [{quoted}](name=Yasei Doubutsu,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=sx1lyVwH,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-04-23T07:51:59.120+0000)
>
> I was told by multiple sources that it would fit. :(
> So im looking into what would actually fit it.
> 
> I use PC case gear, what do you use?

Eh I just am buying parts from wherever I can but I do recommend you go on http://au.pcpartpicker.com/ and click on "Start a system build" it will take you to a list with different parts named, best to start by putting the motherboard you have into the list (as it's generally the centre point of your build) then from there enter any other parts you have, if the parts you have don't show up then they probs aren't compatible cuz it only shows compatible parts while searching. Anyway after you have all the parts you currently have in the list then start browsing through the other categories to see what else will fit in with what you already have.
